Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model

Class Patron

java.lang.Object
bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.model.Patron
public class Patron
extends java.lang.Object
Patron class models a patron (member) of the library.

The class has fields for different patron properties such as name and phone number and has an id field that represents the patron's unique id in the library. In addition, the class has a list of the books that a patron has borrowed.

The class also offers getter and setter methods to get and set the values of the different properties and methods that allow for borrowing, returning and renewing books.

  • Constructor Details

    • Patron

      public Patron​(int id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String phone)
      Create a new Patron instance.

      The constructor initialises a Patron object using the basic mandatory fields a patron should have to exist in the library.

      Parameters:
      id - the patron's id
      name - the patron's name
      phone - the patron's phone

      public java.util.List<Book> getBooks()
      Get a list of books that the patron has borrowed.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of books that the patron has borrowed.

    • borrowBook

      public void borrowBook​(Book book, java.time.LocalDate dueDate) throws LibraryException
      Borrow a book from the library.

      The method creates a new Loan object that associates a book with the patron and updates the book with this loan information. The function also adds the book to the patron's list of borrowed books.

      If the book is on loan by another patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is currently on loan.

      Parameters:
      book - the book that will be borrowed by the patron
      dueDate - the LocalDate value that will be set as the loan's due date
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is currently on loan to another patron

    • renewBook

      public void renewBook​(Book book, java.time.LocalDate dueDate) throws LibraryException
      Renew the loan's due date for a book that is already on loan.

      The method changes (renews) the due date of a book that is currently on loan by the patron.

      If the book to be renewed is not on loan by the patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is not on loan to this patron.

      Parameters:
      book - the book to be renewed
      dueDate - the LocalDate value that will be set as the loan's new due date
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is not on loan to this patron

    • returnBook

      public void returnBook​(Book book) throws LibraryException
      Return a book to the library.

      The method removes the book from the patron's list of borrowed books and returns the book to the library by removing any loan information from the book.

      If the book to be renewed is not on loan by the patron, an exception is thrown with a message saying that the book is not on loan to this patron.

      Parameters:
      book - the book to be returned to the library
      Throws:
      LibraryException - if the book is not on loan to this patron.

    • addBook

      public void addBook​(Book book)
      Add a book to the patron's list of borrowed books.

      This method is used to add books that are on loan by the patron when loading data from the text file storage. The book given as argument to this method should already have the loan information added to it.

      Parameters:
      book - the book to be added to the patron's list of borrowed books
